page.title: 17BIRDS IN GRANTOWN-ON-SPEY
page.content:
The area around Grantown-on-Spey is perhaps most famous for being the summer home of the{Osprey.} Several pairs migrate from Africa each year and stay from April till October. They are best seen at Loch Garten, about 15km from Grantown, where a hide has been constructed.
In the hills beyond Dreggie, to the north of the town{Golden Eagles}are to be found. Also in the hills we find grouse and pheasant, with ptarmigan being found on the higher, mountain areas.
On the lower land{curlews} and{Oyster {Catchers}are common, while even in the town{Chaffinch, Bullfinch}and{ {Yellowhammer}are seen, along with commoner varieties.
